intro: Erigeron paucipetalus, commonly known as the few-petaled blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in the summer, and the leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Erigeron paucipetalus is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments.
